skillTree.localised_description: This Lord belts out orders and can be heard even across a battlefield smothered in the grim noise of war.
Those who bear the Mark of Hysh are practitioners of the magical Lore of Light, and the bane of Chaos, for they are able to control and manipulate the White Wind of Magic.
The relentless drive and fury of the Hammer, harnessed for the protection of this ward’s bearer.
Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +20%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +35%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +50%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Karl Franz's Captain of Scouts is the very best in his field; a hunter truly without peer.
Markus Wulfhart seems to almost bend the air around him – arrows and blades just seem to glance off, if they even connect.
The dense, dark forest of Middenland is the most unforgiving, inhospitable of training grounds, and the place where Wulfhart perfected his survival skills.
As you might expect, the very best hunters make for elite ambushers and skirmishers.

effects.description:
Upkeep: -15% for Huntsmen and Archers units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +8 for Huntsmen units
	(Lord's army)

Missile strength: +7% for Huntsmen and Archers units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Blink and you'll probably be dead.

effects.description:
"Double Shot" Ammunition (extra projectiles) for Huntsmen units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Deprive them of their eyes and they cannot shoot back.
Wulfhart is by far the most successful monster hunter and slayer anywhere in the Old World.

related_attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).
This unit can deploy outside the deployment zone.

skillTree.localised_description: There’s no need to rush when your target has little prospect of escape.

ui_effects.localised_text: Scaled projectile damage against combatants with missing health
Requires line of sight to the target
Scaled projectile damage against combatants with missing health
Requires line of sight to the target

skillTree.localised_description: Silent, swift and very, very deadly, this one can take down the foe from range without breaking a sweat or revealing his position.
Through the skin to kill the soul.
Only the foolish go on the hunt without supplies and a cast-iron plan.
Such advanced ballistic skills tend to rub off on one's subordinates.
Wulfhart considers it his sworn duty to dispatch the Emperor's enemies without the slightest hesitation.

ui_effects.localised_text: Scaled projectile damage against combatants with missing health
Requires line of sight to the target

skillTree.localised_description: When everything else fails, there is always studying the blade. (This skill can accept up to 20 Skill Points)
Wielding the shield is better than returning on it. (This skill can accept up to 20 Skill Points)
Hand-to-hand combat is a lethal match of cut and thrust. However, it’s not all about offensive strikes; parries and other defensive moves can also win the day.
Some creatures charge home with such fury that the very ground shakes beneath their feet.
Full-Plate armour protects the wearer from head-to-foot. Many such suits are blessed or imbued with arcane abilities.
The scars on this storied warrior reveal a veteran of many battles, a being not easy to kill and one worthy of respect and fear.
A deadly blade is especially lethal when in the hands of this master death-maker, killer and slaughterer!
This traditional trapper's tool is a noose made from wire; if the foe struggles, it simply tightens, cutting into the flesh.
Such is their power and ferocity, a wound-maker will ravage the foe, cutting and pulverising until there is only one exit - death.
This warrior is one with their blade; it is an extension of their will, making them a worthy foe in combat.
The iron will and indomitable presence of this leader ensures their followers remain steadfast when facing peril.
A blade that sings in defence will not let its wielder be penetrated.
Bears, Orcs, Kroxigor - prey-size is not a hindrance to the master hunter.
There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +75
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: “We march to war for our Emperor, and Sigmar, our saviour and lord.”

effects.description:
Melee defence: +4 for Spearmen, Swordsmen, Flagellants, and Halberdiers units

skillTree.localised_description: These steeds are bred for speed and war, but foremost it is their gallop which marks them out.

skillTree.localised_description: This Lord expects his men to practice the disciplines of the Pistolkorps, and all be expert marksmen.

skillTree.localised_description: Honest Empire-forged steel is all a state trooper could ask when confronting the myriad foes in battle.

skillTree.localised_description: Patrons of great forges and smiths expect, and are rewarded with, tougher and more enduring war machines.

skillTree.localised_description: Despite what the Dwarfs think, no other race can bring to bear such devastating artillery volleys.

skillTree.localised_description: The frontline will either make or break you. Those who survive become the backbone of any army.

skillTree.localised_description: Some men grow to relish war, dulled to the pain and living solely for the thrill of the kill.

skillTree.localised_description: Those in command of ordnance can potentially decide a battle before the melee has even begun.

skillTree.localised_description: Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
This Lord expects utter obedience from the smallfolk, and has little time for insurrections or petty revolts.
Revered by the masses, such a celebrated leader will inspire many new recruits.
The presence of this Lord ensures a measure of calm, reducing panic and desertion amongst followers.

effects.description:
Attrition: -10% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -20% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -30% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Through our acts, the gods will cleanse the lands.
It is said that Sigmar would bear a mortal wound and carry on fighting; this champion follows the hallowed Warrior-God.

effects.description:
Casualty replenishment rate: +30% for this Lord
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Reinforcements supporting this army can have their arrival point adjusted by +250 metres without incurring any time penalty
Reinforcements supporting this army can have their arrival point adjusted by +600 metres without incurring any time penalty
Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present
Reinforcements supporting this army can have their arrival point adjusted by +1000 metres without incurring any time penalty

skillTree.localised_description: A good quartermaster can ration equipment and foodstuffs efficiently, making supplies last longer.
Proficient with figures, this Lord, or his subordinates, can keep his army fulfilled, even in dire circumstances.
Countless conflicts and a keen sense of awareness have made this Lord difficult to entrap.

effects.description: Chance of intercepting an army using Tunnelling, beast-paths or Worldroots: +5%
Chance of intercepting an army using Tunnelling, beast-paths or Worldroots: +10%

skillTree.localised_description: "Ever thought about joining the Elector's troops, chief? You'd make a good soldier alright."

effects.description:
Recruit rank: +1 for all units
	(Lord's army)

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can deploy outside the deployment zone.
The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).
This unit can fire while on the move.
This unit can move hidden in any terrain.

factionEffects.localised_description: Markus Wulfhart’s great deeds in service to the Empire have earned him the recognition of Karl Franz himself, who has bestowed unto him the title of Huntsmarshal: the Emperor’s Captain of Scouts.

effects.description: Limited Roster: Only basic units are immediately recruitable
Reinforcements from the Empire bring powerful units to bolster your armies
Hostile actions will result in retaliation from local factions, but will also empower your own armies
Lord recruit rank: +3 for Huntsman Generals
Missile strength: +5% for Huntsmen and Archers units

items.colour_text: Carved from Drakwald Oak and enchanted by a powerful Amber Wizard, its shots are guided directly into the hearts of Wulfhart's enemies.

ui_effects.localised_text: Requires line of sight to the target

items.colour_text: The highest standard of protection... whilst also looking pretty good next to one's peers!
The shard is ominous yet unknowable, and possessed of an immense power.

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.

items.colour_text: He who wears this ring is respected by everyone around him, whether he deserves it or not…

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Markus Wulfhart's advanced tracking and slaying skills have earned him both a reputation and the recognition of Karl Franz himself.

effects.description:
Upkeep: -35% for Archers and Huntsmen units
	(Lord's army)

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit can pass through trees.
